title: How to Copy and Paste on Any Device

steps.title: Select what you want to copy:
steps.content: Select what you want to copy: Text: To select text, click and drag the cursor until the text you want to copy is highlighted, then release the click. Files: Select the file on your computer that you want to copy and paste, or you can select multiple files by holding down Ctrl to select multiple files. Images: In most Windows applications, you can select the picture you want to copy by clicking on it once.

steps.title: Right-click on the mouse or trackpad.
steps.content: Right-click on the mouse or trackpad. [1] X Research source If using a trackpad, depending on your computer's settings you can perform a right-click by either using two fingers to click the trackpad or by tapping the far-right side of the trackpad with a single finger.

steps.title: Click Copy.
steps.content: Click Copy . [2] X Research source The selected text, images or files will be copied to the Clipboard (a type of temporary storage) on your computer. Alternatively, press Ctrl + C . In many applications, you can also click Edit in the menu bar, then click Copy .

steps.title: Right-click in the document or field where you want to insert the text or image.
steps.content: Right-click in the document or field where you want to insert the text or image.

steps.title: Click Paste.
steps.content: Click Paste . The text or image will be inserted into the document or field at the place where you put the cursor. Alternatively, press Ctrl + V . In many applications, you can also click Edit in the menu bar, then click Paste .
